title: IT-tekniker med eget ansvar till Ersta diakoni
description:
**Om arbetsplatsen**


Ersta diakoni är Sveriges största idéburna aktör inom vård och omsorg. Vi bedriver sjukvård, socialt arbete, forskning och utbildning, professionellt och utan vinstsyfte.


Ersta diakoni är Sveriges största idéburna aktör inom vård och omsorg. Vår IT-avdelning är en möjliggörare för hela verksamheten och servicedesk är det självklara navet för alla IT-frågor.


Idag är vi ett engagerat team med 17 kollegor som stöttar, utvecklar och förbättrar IT-miljön för hela organisationen.


Hos oss får du både utvecklas i din roll och vara med och utveckla hela vårt arbetssätt!


Som medarbetare hos oss erbjuder vi en rad förmåner som vi hoppas ska ge dig förutsättningar att trivas på jobbet och ha en givande fritid.  

  



**Om rollen**

Det här är en roll för dig som vill ha eget teknikansvar och driva utvecklingen framåt – inte bara lösa tickets. Du blir en viktig “second line”-resurs som stöttar servicedesken och tar vid när frågorna blir mer avancerade.  

  

Du kommer att:

* äga och ansvara för teknikområden (t.ex. M365, Windows-klienter, behörighets- och kontohantering, nätverk eller utskrifter)
* följa upp, fördjupa och lösa ärenden som eskaleras från servicedeskens första linje
* driva och delta i förbättrings- och utvecklingsprojekt inom IT-avdelningen
* samarbeta tvärfunktionellt för att skapa smartare, stabilare och mer proaktiva lösningar
* arbeta med installation, konfiguration och avancerad felsökning av mjukvara, operativsystem och kringutrustning
* använda verktyg som SCCM och Microsoft Intune för klienthantering, utrullningar och uppdateringar
* ta ansvar för att dokumentera processer och lösningar så att kunskap delas och kvaliteten säkras
* utbilda och stötta kollegor i servicedeskens första linje.
  
* 

**Vem är du?**

Du är självgående, analytisk och trivs bäst när du får äga, utveckla och fördjupa dig i teknik. Du har förmågan att ta ansvar för egna teknikområden, driver förbättringar och tycker om att både jobba självständigt och vara spindeln i nätet.


Du gillar att ta tag i komplexa problem, hittar långsiktiga lösningar och är inte rädd för att ta egna initiativ. Samtidigt har du lätt för att förklara och lyfta andra i teamet – och du delar gärna med dig av din kompetens till kollegorna i servicedeskens första linje.


Du delar Erstas värdegrund om att se hela människan och står för professionalism, tillit och hopp.

**Din erfarenhet**


Vi söker dig som har gedigen erfarenhet av IT-support där du tagit ansvar för egna teknikområden. För att lyckas i rollen behöver du ha:

* djup kunskap inom Microsoft 365/Office 365 och Windows-klienter
* erfarenhet av SCCM och Microsoft Intune för klienthantering, programdistribution och policyadministration
* god erfarenhet av ärendehanteringssystem och strukturerad dokumentation
* vana att arbeta med användar- och behörighetsadministration i Active Directory
* erfarenhet av att arbeta projektbaserat och driva förändringsarbete inom IT
* förmåga att lyfta och utbilda andra i teamet


Vi ser positivt på om du har:


* eftergymnasial IT-utbildning eller motsvarande erfarenhet
* erfarenhet från hälso- och sjukvårdsmiljö
* fördjupad kompetens inom nätverk, utskriftshantering och Microsoft 365 Admin Center, avancerad felsökning i Windows och molnbaserade plattformar.
* 

**Övrigt om rekryteringen**

  

Urval sker löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag.

  

Vi tillämpar provanställning som standard.

  

Kontaktperson: Robert Rangdag, IT-Supportchef, Tjänsteägare Klient och identitet, robert.rangdag@erstadiakoni.se


Facklig kontaktperson: Fiona Cameron, SACO, Fiona.cameron@erstadiakoni.se  

  

Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-08-31

 *Observera att vi inte tar emot ansökningar via e-post.*


Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Data Engineer
description:
* Applications are considered on a rolling basis
* Kista
* Hybrid
**Job Description**
-------------------

Are you ready to be at the forefront of digital innovation? Join our dynamic team at Tele2, where Digital Capabilities & Technology (DCT) is the engine behind our products and services. As the essential enabler of our commercial  

ambitions, DCT brings automation and simplicity to the telecommunications industry, revolutionizing the way we connect and communicate.  

Within our organization, you’ll find everything from the backbone infrastructure of technology and IT systems, serving both our external & internal customers, to advanced analytics, AI creation, and frontend development. Our team plays a vital role in ensuring reliable and premium services through delivering exceptional experiences to our end customers, both Consumer and Enterprises, all the while supporting our colleagues within Tele2.


**ABOUT THE ROLE**

We are looking for a Data Pipeline Expert with a track record of +4 years building ingestion and transformation frameworks that can handle large, fast-growing datasets with ease on AWS and Redshift, to join our *B2B Data & Analytical* team *within IT B2B Billing and Data Services*. The team is today responsible for the development in larger technology programs and projects supporting our B2B customer needs.



As a Data Engineer, you will be responsible for developing, maintaining, and optimizing our data pipelines and data products. You will work closely with data scientists, analysts, and other engineers to deliver high-quality, reliable, and efficient data solutions that power business intelligence and analytics initiatives. To succeed in this role, you have a passion for agility, maintain a positive attitude and have the ability to create strong team spirit and relationships across functional teams.


**KEY RESPONSIBILITIES**


* Design, develop, and maintain scalable and efficient data pipelines to extract, transform, and load (ETL) data using Snowflake, Redshift, dbt, Apache Airflow and other cloud-based technologies.


* Collaborate with data scientists, analysts, and business stakeholders to understand data needs and design appropriate solutions.


* Build and maintain data models, ensuring data is accurate, consistent, and easily accessible for analytics and reporting.


* Implement modern data transformation tools and frameworks (e.g., dbt, Apache Airflow) to streamline data processing workflows.


* Monitor and troubleshoot data pipeline issues, ensuring high reliability and data quality.


**Great Place to Work**
-----------------------

* Pension and health care
* Hybrid and flexible work life balance
* Career opportunities
* Parental benefit
* Employee benefits and Tele2 discounts
* Inclusive workplace
**Skills & Requirements**
-------------------------

**QUALIFICATIONS**


* Minimum 4 years of experience in data engineering with a strong focus on modern cloud-based data technologies


* Proficiency in SQL, and experience with data modeling, ETL processes, and data integration


* Hands-on experience with Redshift, including database design, data ingestion, performance optimization, and security. Snowflake is a plus.


* Familiarity with data transformation tools like dbt, Apache Airflow, Talend, or similar tools


* Experience working with AWS cloud platform and its associated data services (e.g., S3, Lambda, Glue, Redshift)


* Experience with version control (Git), Docker, Kubernetes, CI/CD, and infrastructure-as-code tools (Terraform)


* Knowledge of Python, Java, or other programming languages for data engineering tasks is a plus


* Excellent problem-solving and communication skills, with the ability to work collaboratively across teams


* Telecom and B2B industry background is an extra plus
* Proficient in English, oral and written



**Why Tele2**


* We believe in fostering a creative and flexible work environment. You will be part of a culture where teamwork and inclusion are leading the way forward, a place where you bring your whole self to work as the unique person you are. We are committed to building a company that values diversity in all its forms.
* Every employee is important for the company’s success and you will always have an impact through your work with opportunities for growth and development through internal paths.
At Tele2, we work hard to our commitment to lead in sustainability, which has made us a climate leader in Europe according to Financial Times. Sweden’s most sustainable company and ranked 37th globally by Time Magazine and Statista on their inaugural World’s Most Sustainable Companies list, featuring 500 companies from more than 30 countries. We keep reaching new goals as we are bound to shift to a circular economy.  
* 

**Interest and application**  

Would you like to be a part of the Tele2s value-driven and including culture? Then hit the “apply now” button and let’s find out if we’re a match!


Please note that in compliance with personal data management regulations (GDPR), we are unable to accept CVs via email.


To ensure an inclusive and fair recruitment process, we focus on your experiences and skills. Therefore, Tele2 has chosen not to consider cover letters. Instead, we kindly ask you to answer the screening questions included in the application form.



As a step in the recruitment process, Tele2 performs a background check on final candidates.


**Work with great people**
--------------------------

Emma
Digital Capabilities & Technology
*"Everyone at Tele2 always aim for the stars in order to create unlimited possibilities."*
Fanny
Systemspecialist Unified Communications

**About the company**

At Tele2 we work hard to fulfill our commitment to lead in sustainability, being named a climate leader in Europe by The Financial Times. Our Values; Be Brave, Take Action, Make it Simple and Act Cost-efficient.

title: Senior Software Engineer within vehicle motion
description:
Job Description


Our clients in vehicle motion and are looking for experienced Software Engineers with an overall understanding of estimation techniques with proven customer-facing skills. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of rethinking and refactoring complex codebases, with a focus on enhancing maintainability, scalability and flexibility.  

  

Key responsibilities:

* Collaborate with development teams to design, review, and deliver high-quality technical solutions on time.
* Analyze and prevent bugs by identifying root causes and implementing robust architectural improvements.
* Enforce coding standards and ensure software quality through regular code reviews and testing.
* Develop Simulink models for automotive devices with traceability.
* Work with C, AUTOSAR, and embedded systems using the latest standards.


Qualifications


We wish that you have these qualifications:

* Bachelor/Master’s degree in computer/software engineering
* 5+ years of experience in embedded software and system deployment
* Proven experience with a focus on code refactoring and system design in MATLAB/Simulink environment
* Knowledge of automotive domain using Windows/Linux
* Knowledge of development processes for software design i.e., ASPICE and ISO26262
* Good understanding of Agile methodologies (SAFe, Scrum)


We expect you to be a good team player able to integrate into a fast and growing environment requiring challenging collaboration with the technical team/support organization and everyday communication with stakeholders.


Company Description


AFRY provides engineering, design, digital and advisory services. We are devoted experts in industry, energy and infrastructure sectors, creating impact for generations to come. AFRY has Nordic roots with a global reach. Join us in accelerating the transition towards a sustainable society.


Additional Information


Welcome with your application! Please note that we don't accept applications via email.


For any questions regarding the position, please contact:  

Jenny Ljungqvist - Section Manager  

jenny.ljungqvist@afry.com

*At AFRY, we engineer change in everything we do. Change happens when brave ideas come together. When we collaborate, innovate technology, and embrace challenging points of view. That’s how we're making future. We are actively looking for qualified candidates to join our inclusive and diverse teams across the globe. Join us in accelerating the transition towards a sustainable future.*


Apply information


Position


Senior Software Engineer within vehicle motion
Location


Gothenburg
Country


Sweden
Reference number


REF9213Y

Our headquarters are in Stockholm, Sweden yet our businesses and clients extend right across the globe. 

Frösundaleden 2

+46105050000

title: Bli en del av Infinity IT Consulting – Vi söker HR-konsulter!
description:
OM INFINITY IT CONSULTING: Infinity IT Consulting är ett konsultföretag inom IT och Management med en stark företagskultur och teamkänsla. Ditt välmående är vår framgång och vi menar att de bästa konsultaffärerna blir av och genomförs med stolthet när du som medarbetare mår som bäst, så gör även företaget och våra kunder det. Vi jobbar med IT-kunder och partners i hela Skandinavien inom både telekom, verkstadsindustrin, retail, sport & mode och många andra. Vi bygger teamet utifrån våra värderingar som genomsyrar hela företaget. Pannben – Viljan och förmågan att lösa uppgiften, ta ansvar och känna ägarskap, men alltid våga ta hjälp. Enkelhet – Vi krånglar inte till det, varken för oss själva eller för andra! Sunt förnuft och kundnöjdhet i fokus. Laganda – Vi ställer upp för varandra, gör varandra bättre och skrattar varje dag! Långsiktighet – Vi är besatta av att göra bra saker och saker bra, vi låter kortsiktiga vinningar stå tillbaka för långvariga affärsrelationer. Stolthet – Vi är rakryggade, på riktigt och vågar gå vår egen väg! Din IT-karriär kan starta hos just oss och vi ger förutsättningarna för det, eller så är du senior med många års erfarenhet och då ger vi utrymme för allt leda, kompetensutveckla och ge stöd åt våra mer juniora konsulter, och på det viset har vi en härlig mix i konsultteamet av olika utbyten i erfarenhet, intressen och kompetens.

Vill du vara med och utveckla företag och människor i samspel?



På *Infinity IT Consulting* söker vi löpande fler erfarna **HR-konsulter** som vill bidra till att skapa hållbara arbetsmiljöer, stärka organisationer och utveckla medarbetare – både inom **IT-branschen** och andra branscher som **retail, sport, mode och verkstadsindustrin**.



Som konsult hos oss blir du en viktig partner till våra kunder och får möjlighet att arbeta med varierande uppdrag där din kompetens och personlighet gör skillnad. Vi söker dig som är **kommunikativ, relationsskapande och lösningsorienterad.**



 Vi erbjuder en inspirerande miljö med stark teamkänsla



Alltid till din konsultchef för stöd, uppföljning och utveckling i ditt uppdrag



Du får möjlighet att påverka och utvecklas i takt med uppdragen



Är du en erfaren och engagerad HR-konsult, tveka inte att skicka in en ansökan med CV och personligt brev. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig och utforska framtida möjligheter tillsammans!

title: IT Desktop Support Intern
description:
**WHO WE ARE:**
 Glitnor Group was founded by industry veterans with a wealth of experience in founding and managing numerous successful businesses over the past decade. We have a global presence with a unique and proven track record of building and nurturing strong brands, culture & work environment. Our vision is to take global leadership and change the competitive landscape for Game Studios, Game Operators and Lead Generation.
   

  

 Glitnor has enjoyed rapid growth since its foundation in 2018 and now has over 200 team members representing more than 20 nationalities. The company has physical locations in Sweden, Malta, Bulgaria and Spain, and a few remote team members around the world.
   

  

 We are built on the core belief that work should be a source of positivity. We foster an environment where freedom is coupled with responsibility, empowering individuals to harness their talents and drive professional advancement. We believe in promoting internally where possible, encouraging team members to reach the pinnacle of their ability.
   

  

**We are currently seeking an IT Desktop Support Intern to join our growing team. This internship position is for a duration of 6 to 8 months, with a commitment of 16 to 20 hours per week.**
 The chosen candidate will play an important role in configuring, maintaining, and overseeing our company's array of IT resources at our Swedish Office, including, workstations, laptops, printer, and some cloud services. Your primary responsibility will be to assist and support our users in their day to day working day and ensuring their equipment, caters to their needs. This will also include the participation, integration and management of our cloud services, as needed.
   

  

**What will you be doing?**
* Configure, and maintain IT infrastructure including desktops, peripherals, operating systems, standard and custom desktop applications in accordance with the change management process, industry and security best practices.
* Assist the IT Team to adhere to our management processes and applying our security best practices.
* Manage user accounts, permissions, and access rights across various platforms and applications.
* Ensure the stable operation, availability, reliability, and serviceability of the company's IT services, workstations and office networks.
* Maintain and update the IT asset register, ensuring accurate records of all hardware, software, and licensing information.
* Use and manage the internal ticketing system to track, prioritize, and resolve support requests in a timely manner.
* Assist in nurturing a culture of data and network security within our organisation.
* Provide orientation and training to end-users during onboarding and offboarding processes.
* Act as a first line support to end-users.


**Who are you?**
* You have a flair for IT and / or some system administration experience.
* Basic knowledge of network services, monitoring WiFi and Internet Services
* Have exposure to Apple macOS and Windows 10/11 Operating Systems.
* Willing to learn new technologies, such as monitoring tools, remote management tools and access management.
* Knowledge of services such as antivirus or desktop device agents.
* A good knowledge of Internet technologies and concepts.


 By joining us, you're not only gaining an opportunity to work and collaborate with the best talent in our industry, but you’ll also enjoy a range of fantastic perks!
   

  

* A competitive and attractive salary
* A weekly breakfast
* Social events for building strong relationships with colleagues


**At Glitnor we firmly believe that our diversity is what makes us unique and that everyone is welcome to enjoy the ride! We are committed to uphold a high level of diversity and inclusion throughout our group.**
**VILKA ÄR VI?** 
 :
   

  

 Glitnor Group grundades av branschexperter med en rik erfarenhet av att grunda och leda flera framgångsrika företag under det senaste decenniet. Vi har en global närvaro med en unik och beprövad meritlista för att bygga och vårda starka varumärken, kultur och arbetsmiljö. Vår vision är att ta globalt ledarskap och förändra det konkurrensutsatta landskapet för spelstudior, speloperatörer och lead-generering.
   

  

 Glitnor har haft en snabb tillväxt sedan grundandet 2018 och har nu över 200 teammedlemmar som representerar mer än 20 nationaliteter. Företaget har fysiska kontor i Sverige, Malta, Bulgarien och Spanien, samt några distansanställda runt om i världen. Vi trivs med en platt organisationsstruktur, byggd på den grundläggande övertygelsen att arbete ska vara en källa till positivitet. Vi främjar en miljö där frihet går hand i hand med ansvar, vilket ger individer möjlighet att utnyttja sina talanger och driva professionell utveckling. Vi tror på att främja internt där det är möjligt och uppmuntrar teammedlemmar att nå toppen av sin förmåga.
   

  

 Vi söker nu en IT Desktop Support Agent för att gå med i vårt växande team. Den valda kandidaten kommer att spela en viktig roll i att konfigurera, underhålla och övervaka vår företags IT-resurser på vårt svenska kontor, inklusive arbetsstationer, bärbara datorer, skrivare och vissa molntjänster. Ditt primära ansvar kommer att vara att assistera och stödja våra användare i deras dagliga arbete och säkerställa att deras utrustning motsvarar deras behov. Detta inkluderar också deltagande, integration och hantering av våra molntjänster efter behov.
   

  

**Vad kommer du att göra?**
* Konfigurera och underhålla IT-infrastruktur inklusive stationära datorer, kringutrustning, operativsystem, standard- och anpassade desktopapplikationer i enlighet med förändringshanteringsprocessen samt branschens och säkerhetsbästa praxis.
* Assistera IT-teamet att följa våra hanteringsprocesser och tillämpa vår säkerhetsbästa praxis.
* Hantera användarkonton, behörigheter och åtkomsträttigheter över olika plattformar och applikationer.
* Säkerställa stabil drift, tillgänglighet, pålitlighet och servicebarhet av företagets IT-tjänster, arbetsstationer och kontorsnätverk.
* Underhålla och uppdatera IT-tillgångsregistret, säkerställa korrekta register över all hårdvara, mjukvara och licensinformation.
* Använda och hantera det interna ärendehanteringssystemet för att spåra, prioritera och lösa supportförfrågningar på ett tidsenligt sätt.
* Assistera i att vårda en kultur av data- och nätverkssäkerhet inom vår organisation.
* Ge orientering och utbildning till slutanvändare under onboarding- och avstängningsprocesser.
* Fungera som första linjens support för slutanvändare.


**Vem är du?**
* Du har en fallenhet för IT och/eller viss erfarenhet av systemadministration.
* Grundläggande kunskaper om nätverkstjänster, övervakning av Wi-Fi och internettjänster.
* Har erfarenhet av Apple MacOS och Windows 10/11 operativsystem.
* Villig att lära dig nya teknologier, såsom övervakningsverktyg, fjärrhanteringsverktyg och åtkomsthantering.
* Kunskap om tjänster som antivirus eller desktop-enhetsagenter.
* God kunskap om internetteknologier och koncept.


 När du börjar hos oss får du inte bara en möjlighet att arbeta och samarbeta med den bästa talangen i vår bransch, utan du kommer också att njuta av en rad fantastiska förmåner!
   

  

* En konkurrenskraftig och attraktiv lön.
* En veckovis frukost.
* Sociala evenemang för att bygga starka relationer med kollegor.


 På Glitnor tror vi fast på att vår mångfald är det som gör oss unika och att alla är välkomna att njuta av resan!
   

  

 Vi är engagerade i att upprätthålla en hög nivå av mångfald och inkludering inom vår grupp.

title: IT-koordinator
description:
Vill du ha en central roll där du får kombinera din tekniska förståelse med din förmåga att skapa struktur och samarbete? Trivs du bäst när du får jobba nära både människor och teknik? Då kan du vara den IT-koordinator vi letar efter!
 




  





**Om rollen** 





 Som IT-koordinator hos oss blir du en nyckelperson i att säkerställa att vår IT-miljö är stabil, säker och effektiv. Du får arbeta brett – från projektkoordinering och processförbättring till support, dokumentation och säkerhetsfrågor. Rollen passar dig som gillar att ta ansvar, driva på och skapa ordning i ett växande techbolag.
 




  





**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 



* Koordinera IT-projekt och aktiviteter tillsammans med interna team och externa leverantörer
* Säkerställa att tickets har tydliga kravspecifikationer samt dokumentera och summera möten
* Följa upp incidenter och säkerställa att problem hanteras effektivt
* Administrera användarbehörigheter, licenser och IT-kontrakt
* Effektivisera och vidareutveckla IT-processer för ökad kvalitet och smidighet
* Driva användartester och QA i samband med nya system eller förändringar
* Stötta organisationen med IT-relaterade frågor och utbildningar
* Ansvara för utförande och uppföljning av GDPR- och informationssäkerhetsarbete
* Bidra till utvecklingen av rutiner och processer för IT och informationssäkerhet



  





**Vem är du?** 





 Vi söker dig som är strukturerad, kommunikativ och serviceinriktad. Du har en god teknisk förståelse och trivs i en roll där du får översätta mellan verksamhetens behov och IT-lösningar. Du gillar det aktiva tempot och snabba vändningar som sker i en startup och dina personliga egenskaper är viktiga för oss.
 




  





**Vi ser att du har:** 



* Erfarenhet av IT-support, systemadministration eller koordinering
* God förståelse för IT-infrastruktur samt vana att arbeta med molnbaserade verktyg (exempelvis Google Workspace eller liknande)
* Förmåga att arbeta med och sätta upp effektiva processer i olika digitala verktyg
* Förmåga att driva flera uppgifter parallellt och hålla ihop projekt
* Flytande i svenska i tal och skrift
* Goda kunskaper i engelska i tal och skrift



  





**Vi erbjuder** 





 Hos oss blir du en del av ett engagerat team där IT är en central del av verksamhetens utveckling. Vi tror på en levande kontorskultur och ser därför gärna att du är på plats minst tre dagar i veckan – för vi vet att samarbete, idéer och energi blir som bäst när vi möts.
 





 Vi erbjuder en dynamisk arbetsmiljö, möjlighet att påverka och växa i rollen, samt attraktiva anställningsvillkor.
 




  






 📩 Ansök redan idag via denna länk
 
**https://bit.ly/4mQJwbf** 

 Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande.
 





 För frågor om tjänsten, kontakta
 
**Luis Rizo, CTO – lusse@wimt.com**

title: Senior Data Analyst
description:
**Job Description**
**WHAT YOU’LL DO**
 Join the Global Merchandising team within Sales and play a key role in the In & Post Season Value Stream. You’ll work with advanced AI technologies and leverage SQL, programming tools, and data modelling best practices to deliver actionable insights and optimize product performance.
   

  

* Support in-season inventory planning, stock management, and end-of-season sale pricing using AI-powered pricing engines (Mark Down Online and Mark Down Retail).
* Translate large volumes of data into actionable insights that guide strategic decisions across fashion retail and e-commerce.
* Define, monitor, and visualize key KPIs and OKRs to drive transparency and measure success.
* Lead data modelling conversations to ensure optimal data structures and model performance within your product area.
* Act as the go-to analytics expert within your product team, collaborating end-to-end on data-driven product development and business case validation.


***Please note that this is a temporary position for :1 year, starting as soon as possible.***
**Who You’ll Work With**
 You’ll be part of a truly international and cross-functional team, working closely with Data Scientists, Machine Learning Engineers, Business Experts, and Product Managers to bring cutting-edge AI products to life. Collaboration is at the heart of what we do; our team brings together diverse backgrounds and perspectives to solve complex challenges and create real value for millions of customers across global markets. We work in an agile setup that encourages experimentation, continuous learning, and open dialogue. If you're someone who thrives in a fast-paced, curious, and supportive environment, you'll feel right at home here.
   

  

**Who You Are**
*We are looking for people with…*
* A degree in Economics, Business, Supply Chain, Mathematics, Engineering, or a related field.
* Experience in analytics roles within retail, fashion, or tech-driven companies, ideally linked to product or business development.
* Proficient in SQL, Python, or R, with experience using modern data tools such as Git and dbt for managing data transformation workflows.
* A solid understanding of statistical and analytical methods applied to real-world data problems.
* Experience using data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Looker).


*And people who are…*
* Strategic thinkers with a strong analytical mindset and a passion for solving complex problems.
* Clear communicators who can transform data into compelling stories and practical recommendations.
* Team players who thrive in collaborative, agile environments and are comfortable working with a range of stakeholders.


**Who We Are**
 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  

 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  

* We offer all our employee’s attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a 25% staff discount usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
* 30 days holiday
* We offer a collective agreement which includes pension and life insurance
* H&M Incentive Program
* Wellness benefit 3000kr/year
* Benify Benefits Portal
* Community with activities


**JOIN US**
 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  

 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here.
   

  

* We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.

title: Engineering Manager
description:
**Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?** 




  





 Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, while building trust across the world. With our roots in Sweden and a global reach, we deliver smart services that create meaningful social impact. We are committed to protecting you from fraud, harassment, scam calls, and unwanted messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.
 



  




* Top 20 most downloaded apps globally, and the world’s #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than
 **450 million active users** 
 per month.
* Founded in 2009, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.
* A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon, and Tel Aviv, with high ambitions.



  





**We, in the Messaging team** 
 , own everything under the messaging domain at Truecaller - building, transforming, and optimizing existing and new features to make messaging more reliable and secure for our users. With over 400 million users, we operate one of the world's largest Instant Messaging (IM) services.
 



  





**As an Engineering Manager within the messaging team** 
 , you will manage a team of Android engineers. You will also be responsible for day-to-day operations and strategic technical initiatives, serving as a key voice in shaping the team's technical and product direction. You'll guide the engineering team through the exploration, development, and implementation of new solutions and iterations.
 



  





**The impact you will create:** 




* Manage and lead the team to ensure we build our product efficiently and effectively.
* Influence product priorities and scope, offering valuable input in decision-making.
* Communicate complex decisions clearly, weighing the pros and cons of different solutions.
* Mentor and guide engineers, helping them develop both technically and culturally.
* Leverage your experience to establish best practices across the engineering team and beyond.
* Drive project delivery by aligning with cross-functional stakeholders and ensuring the team has everything needed.
* Be hands-on—balance strategic leadership with system designs and reviews to support solutions.
* Stay up-to-date with industry trends and technologies, ensuring the team works with the best tools available.
* Build strong relationships and align efforts within the team and with external partners when necessary.



  





**What you bring in** 



* 2+ years of relevant experience as an Engineering Manager or technical leader.
* 10+ years of experience in Android development.
* Experience with coaching, mentoring, or managing teams of 5+ engineers.
* Experience with Agile methodologies (Scrum/Kanban) and ability to drive efficient development workflows.
* A strong passion for enhancing user experiences and contributing to product strategy.
* Solid understanding of the Android SDK.
* Experience with RESTful APIs.
* Proficiency in Kotlin, Coroutines, and Dependency Injection.
* Excellent communication skills in English.
* Ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.



  





**It would be great if you also have** 



* Knowledge of performance optimization for Android applications.
* Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP) and mobile observability tools.



  





**Life at Truecaller -** 
 Behind the code:
 **https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/** 




  





**Sounds like your dream job?** 




 We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.
 



  





**This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.** 




  





 We only accept applications
 **in English** 
 .
 



  





**What we offer:** 



* **A smart, talented, and agile team:** 
 An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing, and fun environment.
* **A great compensation package** 
 : Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership.
* **Great tech tools:** 
 Pick the computer and phone you most fancy within our budget ranges.
* **Office life:** 
 We strongly believe in in-person collaboration and follow an office-first approach while offering some flexibility. Enjoy your days with great colleagues with loads of good stuff to learn from, and a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages. In addition, every now and then check out the playroom for a fun break or join our exciting parties and or team activities such as Lab days, Running team, movie nights in our cinema, or a Geek lunch. There’s something for everyone!



  





**Come as you are:** 




 Truecaller is diverse, equal, and inclusive. We need a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc. All those things make you who you are, and that’s why we would love to meet you.

title: Machine Learning Engineer Intern
description:
**Skills**
 As a
 **Machine Learning Engineer Intern** 
 , you will play a key role in designing and building machine learning models for our edge ML product. You will tackle challenges that let you apply your skills across software engineering, data science, computer vision and machine learning. By joining our team, you’ll help enhance the reliability and safety of our vehicles, directly contributing to their performance on the road. This is an opportunity to join the team during 6 months in a part-time internship. To put it into specifics you will:
   

  

* Build a cutting-edge machine learning product and see your model deployed on Voi vehicles worldwide.
* Build a machine learning product end-to-end, from dataset creation, PoC model development, edge ML optimisation, to model deployment and business impact measurement.
* Support production-grade models with a focus on reliability and scalability, and high performance.
* Collaborate with a world-class, cross-functional product team, learning from and supporting each other while aligning on priorities and business outcomes.


**What You Need To Embark**
 We are looking for an ambitious and curious student looking to build a career in Machine Learning. In addition to being collaborative and fluent in English we believe the right person has:
   

  

* 1 year or less remaining on a Masters degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Robotics, or related field
* Strong programming skills in Python and experience using Git
* Knowledge in common machine learning techniques such as convolutional neural networks, transfer learning, object detection, has been applying models in frameworks such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, or scikit-learn
* Experience with edge computing or embedded coding is a plus.


**WHY VOI?**
 Working At Voi Is More Than Just a Job; Our People Promise Includes a Personal Voiage Where You Will Grow As a Professional And Be a Part Of a Team And Culture That Builds Something Meaningful For Society. In Addition To This You’ll Have The Opportunity To
   

  

* Join Europes #1 micromobility company
* Work with inspiring, motivated and fun colleagues towards a common goal
* Join the micromobility-revolution and be a part of creating sustainable cities made for living, free from noise and pollution


 Since 2018,
 **Voi** 
 has been on a mission to create safe, sustainable and reliable micromobility for everyone. Today we are the leading shared micromobility operator in Europe, with HQ in Stockholm (Sweden), operating 100,000+ vehicles in 100+ towns and cities across 12 countries, serving 7+ million riders with over 300+ MILLION rides to date, and we have no intention of stopping here! We believe that micromobility will play a central role in changing how people move in our towns and cities in the future and want to ensure that the micromobility transformation happens the right way - through real innovative technology, partnership and transparent dialogue with towns, cities and governments, and by adapting our products to the local needs. In addition to improving quality of life in cities around the world, we are contributing to the solution for climate change by making sustainable transportation options more widely available and promoting renewable energy use and circularity along our supply chain.
   

  

**Diversity Matters**
 As a Voiager, we offer you a friendly, collaborative and fast-paced workplace where you can bring your whole self to work, regardless of gender, age, ethnicity, religion, disability or sexual orientation - and welcome applications from whoever you are, including veterans, those actively serving as a Reservist and their partners. What is most important to us is how you treat others and what skills and value you bring to our team. We believe that having a wide diversity of people with different backgrounds and perspectives within Voi is essential to our success in delivering the best user experience to our equally diverse user base. With employees from over 50 nationalities working within Voi, we believe we have made good progress but know we can still do more - therefore we discourage any photos, personal letters, or disclosure of any information that concerns other information than your professional experience.

title: Senior Product Manager – Product Data & Strategy
description:
**Job Description**
 As a
 **Product Manager** 
 within our
 **Data Product & Strategy team** 
 , you will play a pivotal role in driving the development, implementation, and management of data products within our organization. You will lead a multi-competence group of Data Engineers, Data Analysts, Business Analysts, Data Scientists, and Data and Machine Learning Engineers in close collaboration with key stakeholders to deliver high-quality data products within and outside AIAD.
   

  

 Together with the other Product Managers, you will define the strategic vision and the product roadmap of our data product. This will be based on an understanding of how to apply data and AI, to address the business requirements from stakeholders across the company.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Collaborate with product managers and stakeholders to define the strategic direction for data product development, aligning it with business goals and customer needs.
* Follow agile methodologies and best practices to facilitate efficient and iterative product development.
* Work closely with cross-functional areas, including DE/DS/ML and Platform Arch/design, to identify data product requirements, prioritize features, and ensure timely delivery.
* Define high-level KPIs/OKRs and align them with the respective Product/Engineering Managers, supporting a data-driven environment.
* Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in data management, machine learning, and data product technologies, and evaluate their potential impact on our organization.


**Qualifications**
**WHO YOU ARE**
 We believe you are an ambitious team player, full of drive and optimism. We also believe you are structured and thorough with good communication skills and driven to identify new possibilities and improve ways of working. You are highly solution-oriented, quickly adapting to changes in scope and time plan. To be successful in this role we also see that you:
   

  

* Extensive experience in Product Management
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders
* Functional knowledge of lean-agile development and methodologies as well as product vision creation and product roadmap development
* Ability to build end-to-end product strategy, including definition of scope, roadmap, and KPIs, and understand product development from ideation to release
* Capable of gathering, analyzing, and understanding customer and business needs and understanding impact against product backlog and impact on team
* Able to clearly express the connections between larger business goals and small backlog items for team members
* Technical Expertise: Possess an understanding of data management principles and data product lifecycle to drive the development and delivery of high-quality data products.
* Proficiency in integrating qualitative and quantitative research, product analysis, and customer insights into product requirements.


**Additional Information**
**WHO WE ARE**
 H&M is a fashion brand that offers the latest styles and inspiration, from fashion pieces and unique designer collaborations to affordable wardrobe essentials. Our business idea is fashion & quality at the best price in a sustainable way. Learn more about H&M here.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
**Benefits**
 We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

*In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.*
**Inclusion & Diversity**
*H&M is a part of H&M Group. At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.*
*We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.*

title: Data Engineer
description:
**About us:** 




 We are based in Stockholm and do technical consulting and managed services, with a focus on Data and Machine Learning Engineering.
 



  





 We help clients architect, build, and run modern data platforms in the cloud, covering everything from data pipelines and governance to MLOps. Whether it’s analytics, automation, or deploying models in production, we enable our clients to turn data into insights and predictions that drive real business value.
 



  





**About the role:** 




 We are looking for skilled data engineers who are passionate about using their skills to help businesses make better decisions. As a consultant, you will work with clients to understand their data needs, design and implement solutions, and train them on how to use the data to improve their business.
 



  





 The role involves both consulting projects and contributing to internal product and business development.
 



  





**What you get:** 




 You'll find a collaborative and fun environment where people are engaged and always willing to help each other out. We also have a lot of fun together, both inside and outside of work.
 



  





**Requirements:** 
 Minimum 3 years of experience in Data Engineering on the public cloud, and you must be based in the Stockholm area.
 



  





**Buzzword bingo:** 
 AWS, Azure, GCP, Databricks, Snowflake, DBT, Python, SQL
 



  





**Read more about Playground and our work at:** 

*playgroundgroup.io*

title: Datacenter Technician
description:
**Who are we?**
 Equinix is the world’s digital infrastructure company®, operating over 260 data centers across the globe. Digital leaders harness Equinix's trusted platform to bring together and interconnect foundational infrastructure at software speed. Equinix enables organizations to access all the right places, partners and possibilities to scale with agility, speed the launch of digital services, deliver world-class experiences and multiply their value, while supporting their sustainability goals.
   

  

 Joining our operations team means that you will be at the forefront of all we do, maintaining critical facilities infrastructure as part of a close-knit team delivering best-in-class service to our data center customers. We embrace diversity in thought and contribution and are committed to providing an equitable work environment that is foundational to our core values as a company and is vital to our success.
   

  

**Job Summary**
 Are you keen to develop skills in a data center environment? We are looking for applicants who are keen to learn and develop their career in our market-leading data centers in Stockholm.
   

  

 Equinix is the world's largest data center and colocation provider.
   

  

 Our three data centers in Stockholm provide more than 13,000 square meters of colocation space to over 175 companies locally and globally.
   

  

 At Equinix we look for dynamic, customer and team focused Data Center Technicians who thrive in a fast-paced environment. A career at Equinix means constant opportunities to learn new skills and grow in new directions. We look for people who are customer service driven and who pride themselves on their technical skills alongside their problem-solving skills and innovative approach.
   

  

 As a Data Center Technician, you will be part of a team that is fundamental to our Equinix Operations department. The team provides 24 hours, 365 days per year support to our customers and the data center by conducting circuit maintenance, installations and advanced testing. They are also responsible for the daily upkeep and operation readiness of Equinix’s data centers.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 Installations
   

  

* Installs cages, cabinets, cable containments, cabinets and customer equipment
* Installs & modify Cold Aisle Containments to ensure optimal Airflow


 Cross Connects
   

  

* Installs/Tests/Modifies cross connects per SOPs and ensures proper cable management of: coax, fiber, twisted pair copper and intra-building cross connects
* Installs and tests advanced cross connects circuits (switched, multiplexed, etc.)
* Installs and test Data Center Link cross connects using Fluke and JDSU testers


 Ticket Management
   

  

* Determines work priorities from the ticket system queue (eg. Siebel) and ensures adherence to all commitment times


 Testing/Troubleshooting
   

  

* Conducts carrier circuit testing


 Documentation/Reporting
   

  

* Maintains detailed written records of all work activity


 Facility Upkeep
   

  

* Support Facility Engineers by performing visual inspections while reporting and resolving issues


 Projects
   

  

* Supports senior staff on large scale projects


 Training
   

  

* Completes all assigned training in a timely manner. Equinix have an in-depth Training and development program designed to help new employees adjust to the workplace successfully, plus on-the-job-training, which helps new starters obtain the knowledge and skills they need to complete their tasks through a systematic training program


 Customer Management
   

  

* Supports customer satisfaction through timely and precise order execution


**Qualifications**
 Essential
   

  

* Well-versed in both written and spoken English language
* Basic Computer skills – MS Office
* Experience in customer service
* Previous experience in a technical role
* Works in a shift rotation that includes day / night shifts / weekends / holidays


 Desirable
   

  

* Basic understanding of Swedish is a big plus (not a requirement)


 This is a great opportunity to join a company that is growing quickly and still manages to keep an authentic and humble environment where the company culture is at the heart of our success.
   

  

 Please take a look at our
 *'History, Culture and Future of Equinix'* 
 video on YouTube where we interviewed people from around the company and asked them why they like working for Equinix: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uTejQmBMA1s&feature=youtu.be
   

  

 Equinix is committed to ensuring that our employment process is open to all individuals, including those with a disability. If you are a qualified candidate and need assistance or an accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
   

  

 Equinix is an Equal Employment Opportunity and, in the U.S., an Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to unlawful consideration of race, color, religion, creed, national or ethnic origin, ancestry, place of birth, citizenship, sex, pregnancy / childbirth or related medical conditions, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital or domestic partnership status, age, veteran or military status, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, political / organizational affiliation, status as a victim or family member of a victim of crime or abuse, or any other status protected by applicable law.

title: Finance Business Partner
description:
Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 175,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**About The Role**
 As Finance Business Partner you will have a significant role in our Product & Tech team. You will play a pivotal role in increasing business insights via improved understanding of operational business data as well as being a finance representative to the Product organization. This role is primarily focused on the Messaging area of Sinch, which encompasses multiple sub products such as Global SMS, P2P and Operator Software. In this role, you will partner with the Senior Finance Business Partner for the Messaging area and you will support the product organization in terms of both ad hoc and recurring analysis.
   

  

 In this role you will play an important part of the team and in shaping the support for the Product area Messaging within our Product Finance function. We have great trust in our team, you will have influence, and we will always value your opinion, knowledge, and expertise. You will have the freedom to challenge current methods, drive ideas and initiatives that may impact the way we operate on a larger scale. You will join a passionate team that strives for constant improvements in the operational data as well as financial insights and delivery.
   

  

 This role is located at Sinch HQ in Stockholm, Sweden. You will work closely with the Senior Finance Business Partner for our Product area Messaging, who will be your team lead, while formally reporting to the VP of Product & Tech Finance.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Perform long term trend analysis on segments, markets, product, pricing, cost, volumes and various use cases
* Support budget, forecast and business planning
* Month end analysis. Support teams and management with regional result data and trend analysis by market/product/client
* Intra-month data analysis. Pick up and follow up on large changes to traffic, costs or revenue including customer reviews, destinations with appropriate teams
* Partner with Product leaders within the product area to drive achievement of financial and operational targets
* Conduct financial modelling to assess product profitability
* Deliver frequent and time sensitive ad hoc analyses including new business cases and new product launches, including pricing and profitability calculations
* Continuously work on improving our processes and daily tasks with the team
* Support in establishing financial benchmarks of competition and internal benchmarks


**Requirements**
 To be successful in this role, you enjoy working in a fast-paced international environment and thrive in a climate of change. You provide exceptional service and have a strong drive to bring value to your stakeholders. You have excellent business modeling and data analytical skills and deep understanding of business drivers.
   

  

* Several years of proven experience in business control, analysis, consulting, or related roles. Ideally from a Telco or Tech company or complex global organization with large datasets.
* Ability to consolidate and interpret large datasets for decision making.
* Experience from working as a finance support function collaborating with business owners.
* Proficiency in financial modelling and variance analysis.
* Depth knowledge and understanding of financial reporting and analysis.
* Advanced user in Excel.
* Experience in ERP systems, BI tools (Tableau) and Planning tools (Anaplan) is a plus.
* Fluency in English is required


 Our corporate language is English, please submit your application in English.
   

  

**Our recruitment process**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Country Manager, Sweden
description:
We are looking for an experienced, influential, and selfless leader to serve as Country Manager for Sweden, based at our Stockholm office!
   

  

 This is a senior, high-impact position reporting to the Managing Director for Northern Europe, with a remit to represent Spotify across local stakeholders, drive the Swedish business agenda, and inspire our teams on the ground.
   

  

 Sweden is Spotify’s founding market and carries cultural, industry, and brand significance. This role blends ownership for our Swedish business with external representation, cultural leadership, and deep stakeholder engagement. It requires someone who can lead with credibility in Swedish public life, support company priorities, and embed the Swedish market well into the regional Northern Europe structure.
   

  

 What You’ll Do
   

  

* Drive and coordinate Spotify’s business in Sweden (and the Nordics) across Music, Podcast, Marketing and Strategy/Planning.
* Collaborate with cross-functional regional leads in Music, Podcast and Marketing to ensure Sweden-specific plans are aligned with Northern Europe and global priorities.
* Lead the strategic planning cycle, translating regional strategic goals into relevant local action championing both accountability and collaboration. Help the teams to prioritise activities and to balance agility with focus so we can ‘dream big and act fast’.
* Serve as a spokesperson when required and represent the company in public forums (regulators, media, industry bodies, partners) and high-level stakeholder discussions in alignment with leaders from Government Affairs, Comms, Legal and Music
* Support and strengthen Sweden’s leadership voice within the broader Nordic and European tech and media landscape.
* Serve as a unifying and visible presence across all Spotify teams in the Stockholm office
* Foster a culture of openness, ambition, and belonging, ensuring teams feel connected to both local and regional leadership.
* Inspire and challenge the teams to live Spotify’s culture, embracing the best of start-up innovation, agility and risk-appetite, while leveraging the brand, technology and impact of a market leader.
* Actively contribute to making the Stockholm office a dynamic, high-energy hub for the company.


 Who You Are
   

  

* Proficient in Swedish and English, with deep familiarity with the country’s political, cultural, and business landscape.
* A seasoned, self-aware leader with strong executive presence, capable of engaging credibly with government officials, media, and industry leaders.
* A selfless cross-functional problem solver who thrives in a matrixed environment, balancing local insight with regional priorities and global strategies.
* Business-minded with a passion for music, audio, and innovation; you understand Sweden’s role as a key influencer in the media and tech conversation.
* An inspiring, hands-on leader who can energise others, especially in times of change or ambiguity. A strong communicator who leads with humility, integrity, and focus - capable of bringing people together and creating momentum.
* Proven experience in leading country-level business operations or holding a senior external-facing leadership role within a regulated, fast-moving industry.
* Background in consumer tech, media, entertainment, or music-related sectors.
* Experience managing public affairs, communications, or external partnerships in a high-stakes environment.
* Familiarity with Nordic and European policy and media environments.


 Where You’ll Be
   

  

* You’ll be based in our Stockholm office


 Spotify is an equal opportunity employer. You are welcome at Spotify for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what’s playing in your headphones. Our platform is for everyone, and so is our workplace. The more voices we have represented and amplified in our business, the more we will all thrive, contribute, and be forward-thinking! So bring us your personal experience, your perspectives, and your background. It’s in our differences that we will find the power to keep revolutionizing the way the world listens.
   

  

 At Spotify, we are passionate about inclusivity and making sure our entire recruitment process is accessible to everyone. We have ways to request reasonable accommodations during the interview process and help assist in what you need. If you need accommodations at any stage of the application or interview process, please let us know - we’re here to support you in any way we can.
   

  

 Spotify transformed music listening forever when we launched in 2008. Our mission is to unlock the potential of human creativity by giving a million creative artists the opportunity to live off their art and billions of fans the chance to enjoy and be passionate about these creators. Everything we do is driven by our love for music and podcasting. Today, we are the world’s most popular audio streaming subscription service.

title: Consulting Associate Director- Cloud Transformation
description:
At
 **Gartner Consulting** 
 , we don't just advise; we equip leaders with
 **objective, data-driven insights** 
 from our unparalleled research and advisory business. As an Associate Director, you will lead complex cloud transformations, leveraging our proprietary frameworks and
 **unique access to enterprise data and analyst expertise** 
 to help clients make the right technology choices and achieve measurable business outcomes. You will leverage your understanding of cloud architectures and emerging technologies to shape transformation journeys, ensuring alignment with organizational goals and industry best practices.
 



**Key Responsibilities:** 




 · Strategic Cloud Advisory: Partner with senior stakeholders to define cloud vision, strategy, and transformation roadmaps that support business growth, agility, and resilience.
 



 · Cloud Value Realization: Identify opportunities for cost optimization, scalability, and competitive differentiation through effective cloud utilization and modernization.
 



 · Transformation Leadership: Lead cloud readiness assessments, business case development, and executive workshops to build consensus and drive change across business and IT functions.
 



 · Program Oversight: Manage cloud transformation initiatives, ensuring alignment with governance, security, compliance, and financial management standards.
 



 · Stakeholder Engagement: Communicate complex cloud concepts in clear, business-focused language to facilitate decision-making and cross-functional collaboration.
 



 · Continuous Improvement: Monitor cloud adoption metrics, provide actionable insights, and foster a culture of innovation and continuous learning.
 



**Required Experience & Skills:** 




 · Fluent in both Swedish & English
 



 · Demonstrated experience in management consulting, digital transformation, or cloud strategy roles.
 



 · Ability to translate business requirements into actionable cloud strategies and solutions, leveraging knowledge of service and deployment models (IaaS, PaaS, SaaS; public, private, hybrid).
 



 · Familiarity with major cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and their strategic capabilities, as well as the current trends and best practices.
 



 · Understanding of cloud governance, security, compliance, and risk management principles.
 



 · Experience leading cloud projects using Agile methodologies, ensuring timely delivery and adaptability to evolving client needs.
 



 · Exceptional communication skills, with a track record of engaging and influencing senior stakeholders.
 



**Preferred Qualifications:** 




 · Experience with cloud reference architectures, cloud landing zones, and modern application delivery models (containerization, serverless, microservices).
 



 · Knowledge of data integration and migration strategies to support seamless transformation.
 



 · Relevant cloud certifications are advantageous but not mandatory.
 



**Why Join Us?** 




 · Work with the World's Best Data: Gain unmatched access to Gartner's proprietary research, data, and a network of 2,000+ industry analysts. You'll deliver advice that is objective, actionable, and backed by the most comprehensive IT data in the world and in collaboration with a team of forward-thinking consultants in a dynamic, growth-oriented environment.
 



 · Focus on the Right Advice, Not the Next Project: Unlike traditional consulting, our model prioritizes client success over project duration. Your goal is to provide unbiased, impactful advice, not to prolong engagements.
 



 · Unrivalled Professional Development: Our internal knowledge sharing, direct access to analysts, and dedicated training programs ensure you're always at the forefront of cloud trends.
 



  





 #LI-WB1

title: Workstream Lead – IT Stream
description:
**Key Responsibilities** 



* Consultant with experience in both
 **SAP** 
 and
 **IT management** 
 (both are mandatory). Examples of prior roles: AM Lead, Service Manager, Service Desk Responsible, etc.
* Report to Global Process Owner for IT and Program Management.
* Plan and lead the successful delivery of the project workstream
 **“IT”** 
 , including:
* IT processes
* IT system decommissioning
* IT documentation
* IT change and receiving organization leadership
* IT support model/governance
* IT security and controls / roles
* IT training coordination
* Coordinate with other relevant workstreams in the program and within the business:
* Hypercare and business continuity
* Close coordination with SI-partner (Deloitte)
* Provide and ensure business context and expertise to secure the best possible solution, process, and system (SAP + relevant integrated legacy systems).
* Drive and ensure resolution/closure of identified solution gaps (process and system) together with SI-partner, business, and IT team.
* Ensure stakeholder collaboration (reference groups, meeting forums, expectation management).
* Secure communication and collaboration with external stakeholders.
* Lead, plan, and coordinate resources within the workstream.
* Act as an ambassador for the new solution.



**Required Skills and Qualifications** 




**Educational Background:** 



* Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.
* Certifications in SAP S/4 HANA are advantageous.



**Professional Experience:** 



* Proven experience in project management with focus on IT enablement in maintenance, governance, processes, and organization.
* Preferably in manufacturing sectors, but not required.
* ITIL and ITSM tool experience.
* Strong experience with SAP implementations, particularly SAP S/4HANA.
* Experience with both custom-built and ERP-systems, with good understanding of their challenges.
* **Mandatory:** 
 Proven work experience from a line IT organization (e.g., AM Lead, Service Manager, Helpdesk Manager) – not only project management experience.



**Language:** 



* English (primary)
* Swedish (secondary)



**Soft Skills:** 



* Strong leadership and team management skills.
* Strong planning and organizational skills.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to work effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Problem-solving abilities and a strategic mindset.

title: Spontanansökan
description:
**Kort om oss**
 Linklaters LLP lämnar juridisk rådgivning till världens ledande företag, sponsorer och finansiella institutioner i de mest komplexa transaktionerna och ärendena. Med 31 kontor i de främsta affärs- och finanscentra, levererar Linklaters en unik service till klienter över hela världen. Läs mer om oss på www.linklaters.com eller lyssna på vår podd här.
   

  

**Vem kan söka?**
 Detta är en annons skapad för dig som antingen är:
   

  

* intresserad av ett extrajobb vid sidan av dina studier, eller
* nyligen eller inom kort avslutar dina juridikstudier eller tingsnotariat och är intresserad av en heltidstjänst som biträdande jurist.


 I de fall där vi inte har en specifik annons ute kan du använda denna annons för att visa ditt intresse för en eventuell anställning hos oss.
   

  

*Eftersom denna annons avser spontanansökningar kommer vi endast att återkoppla till de sökande om ett behov uppstår, och då till dem vars profil stämmer överens med våra krav.*
 Vid frågor, vänligen kontakta Marie Lundqvist, HR Advisor.
   

  

**Technical Skills**
**This list of duties and responsibilities above is not exhaustive. It is intended to describe the general content of, and requirements for, the performance of this job. As such, the role may also include the undertaking of additional tasks as required.**

title: Risk Manager
description:
Stockholm, Sweden
 



  





 Effective risk management involves a holistic view of various types of risks (e.g. insurance risk, operational risk, financial risk, etc.) and their interactions with each other. Enterprise Risk Management (ERM) enables informed strategic thinking, better decision making, and enhances the ability of the business to respond quickly in a dynamic and challenging environment.
 



  





 You will be working in the Risk function, based in the Amsterdam office with a proportion of remote working possible, and be involved in a range of Risk activities for the XLICSE Benelux and Nordics branches, as the main focus, and for the wider risk function of XLICSE. The key role of the Risk Manager is the identification, management and monitoring of operational risks in the XLICSE Benelux and Nordics branches
 



  





 You will report to the Deputy CRO XLICSE with a second reporting line to the local branch country manager.
 



  





 What you’ll be doing
 



  





**What will your essential responsibilities include?** 




  




* Working effectively with the XLICSE Benelux and Nordics branches in the identification, management and monitoring of operational risks. This will include coordinating the submission of operational incidents, production of the annual Operational Risk Assessment, presentation at local governance forums and tracking of these risks.
* Member of the Benelux and Nordics branch Leadership team representing the risk function which includes participation in Leadership team meetings, local governance forums and attendance at Northern Europe Leadership Team seminars.
* Provide risk training as relevant at leadership team level and across the branch as required.
* Production of the quarterly Benelux and Nordics branch risk dashboards and presentation at local branch governance forums and XLICSE Audit, Risk and Compliance Committee.
* Contribute to 2nd opinion on business plan for XLICSE with identification of key local strategic risks for XLICSE Benelux and Nordics branches.
* Support roll out of policies and procedures across the branch, including enhancement of risk culture.
* Support roll out of internal control framework across the Benelux and Nordics branches, including testing as applicable for local controls.
* While based in Amsterdam, you will travel to the Nordics branch (Stockholm) on a quarterly basis.
* Working closely with the XLICSE Risk team based in Dublin in supporting XLICSE wide risk activities, e.g. project risk assessments, and collaborating with the other European Branch risk managers on emerging risks and issues.
* Collaborating with the AXA XL Centres of Excellence, as required, for example information risk management.
* Support any ad hoc regulatory request, locally or from the Central Bank of Ireland.
* Engage with internal audit, as required.
* As part of the ERM team, identify any shortfall in expected compliance with the emerging regulatory requirements and aid in developing plans to address any shortfall.



  





 What you’ll bring
 



  





 We’re looking for someone who has these abilities and skills:
 



  





**Required Skills And Abilities** 




  




* Proven experience of working in a Risk, Compliance or Internal Audit function for an insurance company is essential.
* Enterprise Risk Management Framework experience, in particular the assessment of operational risk in a similar role.
* Experience in assimilating significant amounts of information for problem solving.
* Outstanding analysis skills (both quantitative and qualitative).
* Clear communication, written and presentation, will be important for presenting results and solutions.
* Thorough data interpretation skills and attention to detail are a must to ensure producing high quality, reliable analysis.



  





**Desired Skills And Abilities** 




  




* You will be working in a dynamic, geographically dispersed team so you will need to be highly adaptable and comfortable both working on your own initiative and as a keen team player.
* Graduate degree and/or studying towards an insurance or Risk Management qualification (e.g. FRM, CFA).



  





 Who we are
 



  





 AXA XL, the P&C and specialty risk division of AXA, is known for solving complex risks. For mid-sized companies, multinationals and even some inspirational individuals we don’t just provide re/insurance, we reinvent it.
 



  





 How? By combining a comprehensive and efficient capital platform, data-driven insights, leading technology, and the best talent in an agile and inclusive workspace, empowered to deliver top client service across all our lines of business − property, casualty, professional, financial lines and specialty.
 



  





 With an innovative and flexible approach to risk solutions, we partner with those who move the world forward.
 



  





 Learn more at
 
 axaxl.com
 




  





 What we offer
 



  





**Inclusion** 




  





 AXA XL is committed to equal employment opportunity and will consider applicants regardless of gender, sexual orientation, age, ethnicity and origins, marital status, religion, disability, or any other protected characteristic. At AXA XL, we know that an inclusive culture and enables business growth and is critical to our success. That’s why we have made a strategic commitment to attract, develop, advance and retain the most inclusive workforce possible, and create a culture where everyone can bring their full selves to work and reach their highest potential. It’s about helping one another — and our business — to move forward and succeed.
 



  




* Five Business Resource Groups focused on gender, LGBTQ+, ethnicity and origins, disability and inclusion with 20 Chapters around the globe.
* Robust support for Flexible Working Arrangements
* Enhanced family-friendly leave benefits
* Named to the Diversity Best Practices Index
* Signatory to the UK Women in Finance Charter



  





 Learn more at
 
 axaxl.com/about-us/inclusion-and-diversity
 
 . AXA XL is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
 



  





**Total Rewards** 




  





 AXA XL’s Reward program is designed to take care of what matters most to you, covering the full picture of your health, wellbeing, lifestyle and financial security. It provides competitive compensation and personalized, inclusive benefits that evolve as you do.
 



  





 We’re committed to rewarding your contribution for the long term, so you can be your best self today and look forward to the future with confidence.
 



  





**Sustainability** 




  





 At AXA XL, Sustainability is integral to our business strategy. In an ever-changing world, AXA XL protects what matters most for our clients and communities. We know that sustainability is at the root of a more resilient future. Our 2023-26 Sustainability strategy, called “Roots of resilience”, focuses on protecting natural ecosystems, addressing climate change, and embedding sustainable practices across our operations.
 



  





**Our Pillars** 




  




* Valuing nature: How we impact nature affects how nature impacts us. Resilient ecosystems - the foundation of a sustainable planet and society - are essential to our future. We’re committed to protecting and restoring nature - from mangrove forests to the bees in our backyard - by increasing biodiversity awareness and inspiring clients and colleagues to put nature at the heart of their plans.
* Addressing climate change: The effects of a changing climate are far-reaching and significant. Unpredictable weather, increasing temperatures, and rising sea levels cause both social inequalities and environmental disruption. We're building a net zero strategy, developing insurance products and services, and mobilizing to advance thought leadership and investment in societal-led solutions.
* Integrating ESG: All companies have a role to play in building a more resilient future. Incorporating ESG considerations into our internal processes and practices builds resilience from the roots of our business. We’re training our colleagues, engaging our external partners, and evolving our sustainability governance and reporting.
* AXA Hearts in Action: We have established volunteering and charitable giving programs to help colleagues support causes that matter most to them, known as AXA XL’s “Hearts in Action” programs. These include our Matching Gifts program, Volunteering Leave, and our annual volunteering day - the Global Day of Giving.



  





 For more information, please see axaxl.com/sustainability.

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
 GCP requirements:
   

  

* Familiar with BigQuery, can code SQL
* Familiar with Cloud composer / airflow
* Familiar with IAM, service account
* Familiar with Data catalog
* Understand Infrastructure as Code
* Good to have knowledge with Dataflow, K8s, Vertex AI pipeline, Kubeflow pipeline


 Cloud agnostic skills:
   

  

* Python:
* Deep knowledge about python programing, practice OOP, following coding best practice, know how to use flake8, mypy, black, SonarQube and pre-commit
* Deep knowledge in unit test and end to end test, familiar with Pytest, fixtures, unittest etc
* Unix:
* Familiar with popular Unix system, know how to install sth in docker.
* Familiar with shell
* Git:
* Know how to create PR and solve merge conflict.
* Can create CI/CD pipeline in Github Actions using best practice
* Docker
* Deep understanding with Docker
* DBT
* Deep Knowledge in DBT, preferably with GCP
* SQL
* Deep knowledge of SQL
* Deep understanding with Data modeling, system design


**Application deadline:**
