title: Senior DevOps Engineer
company_industry: Telecommunications and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
I’m Jasin Ali, and I’m heading the Trouble Ticketing Platform. As a member of my team, you’ll play a key role in maintaining reliability of our on-premises ServiceNow instance – consolidated Trouble Ticketing system that supports Telia’s Service Assurance processes across all countries and for all technology domains.
   

  

**As a DevOps Engineer**
 You’ll ensure the availability and performance of our production and non-production ServiceNow environments, improve system reliability and delivery speed, and support ongoing innovation. You’ll provide operational support, collaborate with development and infrastructure teams, and drive automation to build scalable, resilient systems - all while maintaining high standards for service quality and performance.
   

  

**Who We're Looking For**
 At Telia, we’re building a strong, collaborative tech team that values hands-on problem solving and continuous learning. As a senior team member, you’ll play a key role in shaping the team’s future as we grow and bring in junior profiles. We work in a small, agile environment where teamwork and adaptability are essential. If you’re ready to lead by example, tackle challenging problems, and be part of an exciting journey, this is the place for you.
   

  

 Required:
   

  

* Expertise in Red Hat Enterprise Linux and PostgreSQL, with strong networking fundamentals
* Proficient in structured and object-oriented programming, with experience in languages such as Python, Bash, or JavaScript
* Setting up, maintaining, and working within continuous integration (CI) pipelines
* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Engineering, or a related field, or equivalent practical experience
* Fluent in English (both verbally and written)


 Preferred qualifications include experience in ServiceNow development (ideally with on-premises installations), good knowledge of the ITIL framework, and hands-on experience working with RESTful API integrations and messaging platforms such as Apache Kafka. Familiarity with monitoring tools like Grafana and Prometheus is also highly valued.
   

  

**We are more than a workplace**
 Join our inclusive team and collaborate with over 15,000 talented colleagues from around the globe. Recognized as a Climate Leader in the Nordics and Baltics, we're passionate about creating great products and delivering extraordinary customer experiences while always prioritizing sustainability. We believe our people are our most valuable asset, ensuring everyone feels welcome and valued. When you join us, you'll receive a comprehensive benefits package tailored to your local market, opportunities for remote work, and more. You'll also have the chance to earn a bonus based on your performance and Telia's results. If you want to make a real impact, this is the place where you belong.
   

  

**Ready to make better happen?**
 We´re looking forward to your application by 2025-09-05. Please apply through our recruitment system to keep your data safe, as we can’t accept resumes via email. Required background checks will be performed.
   

  

 Got questions? Please reach out to me at jasin.ali@teliacompany.com or connect with me on LinkedIn.
   

  

  

  

**Join us and let’s make better happen – together!**

title: CTO (Sweden)
description:
Key Responsibilities:
 * Define and execute the technology vision and strategy aligned with Vortech’s business goals and market demands.
* Lead, inspire, and grow a diverse team of engineers, developers, and technical leaders.
* Oversee the design, development, deployment, and maintenance of cutting-edge software platforms and gaming products.
* Implement best practices in software development, system architecture, security, scalability, and data management.
* Drive innovation through emerging technologies such as AI, blockchain, and data analytics to enhance user experience and operational efficiency.
* Collaborate closely with other departments—product, marketing, operations—to ensure technology supports company growth and customer satisfaction.
* Manage technical partnerships and vendor relationships.
* Ensure compliance with data protection, regulatory requirements, and cybersecurity standards.
* Monitor industry trends and competitors to keep Vortech at the forefront of technology.
* Report regularly to the CEO and Board on technology performance, risks, and opportunities.


 Required Qualifications:
 * Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related fields.
* Proven experience as a CTO, VP of Engineering, or senior technology leader in a fast-growing tech company, preferably in gaming, fintech, or digital platforms.
* Strong technical background in software development, cloud infrastructure, AI, blockchain, and data systems.
* Demonstrated success in leading high-performing tech teams and delivering scalable, secure software products.
* Deep understanding of agile methodologies, DevOps, and modern development practices.
* Experience working with multi-disciplinary teams and cross-functional leadership.
* Excellent strategic thinking, problem-solving, and communication skills
* Familiarity with regulatory compliance, cybersecurity, and data privacy.
* Must have experience in Slot games and Livestream.



**Preferred Skills** 



* Experience with B2B platform solutions, SaaS models, or online gaming industry.
* Hands-on experience with AI, blockchain, or big data technologies.
* Startup or scale-up experience in a rapidly evolving market.
* Ability to operate in an international and multicultural environment.

title: Platform Engineer
description:
**Motorica is at a breakthrough moment.** 




  





 We’ve built a generative AI animation platform that creates AAA-quality character animation at a fraction of the traditional cost and time.
 



  





 Already recognized as a leader in the rapidly emerging motion modality; one of the six fundamental generative AI modalities alongside image, video, audio, text, and geometry, we’re transforming how studios produce lifelike, dynamic animation.
 



  





 By combining our proprietary Motion Capture dataset with cutting-edge diffusion models, we're reducing one of the biggest bottlenecks in gaming and cinematic production: the need for expensive, time-consuming MoCap sessions or manual keyframing.
 



  





 Studios that once spent hundreds of thousands of dollars on animation can now create production-ready sequences in minutes.
 



  





 With early demand from major studios and rapid scaling ahead, we now need to ensure our own teams can build, test, and deploy faster, more securely, and more reliably than ever. That’s where you come in.
 



  





**The Role:** 




  





 As our first Platform Engineer, you will be the foundation of our internal developer platform. You’ll design and maintain the systems that keep our development capacity high while ensuring security, compliance, and cost efficiency.
 



  





 You’ll define the “paved road” for developer experience, implement security best practices, and optimize our cloud usage for AI/ML workloads. Your work will directly influence how quickly we deliver breakthroughs to customers, while keeping our platform resilient and compliant.
 



  





**What you will do:** 




  




* Provide common infrastructure guidance, reusable patterns, and automated tooling to engineering teams.
* Own the “paved road” for developers, reducing friction and cognitive load.
* Champion and implement security best practices across the entire platform.
* Play a key role in achieving ISO 27001 certification through technical implementation and evidence gathering.
* Build and operate a highly reliable and cost-efficient platform, with particular focus on optimizing GPU-heavy AI/ML workloads.



  





**Weekly/Recurring Responsibilities:** 




  




* Manage CI/CD systems (GitHub Actions, GitLab CI) and track key metrics like build times, deployment frequency, and failure rates.
* Oversee cloud environments (AWS, GCP), including health, security, and cost reporting.
* Lead security scans, audits, and vulnerability remediation.
* Maintain observability stack (Prometheus, Grafana, Datadog, GCP Logging), ensuring meaningful dashboards and alerts.
* Act as point-of-contact for ML Research team’s infra requests (GPU access, specialized pipelines).
* Be the first line of support for developer infrastructure issues.
* Define and own the platform roadmap, prioritizing high-impact improvements.



  





**What we are looking for:** 




  




* Proven experience in Platform Engineering, SRE, or DevOps, ideally in high-growth or AI/ML-heavy environments.
* Strong grasp of CI/CD systems, cloud infrastructure (AWS/GCP), and containerization (Docker/Kubernetes).
* Familiarity with observability, monitoring, and incident response best practices.
* Security mindset with hands-on experience in audits, compliance (ISO 27001, SOC2, etc.), and vulnerability management.
* Strong communication skills; you’ll be interfacing with developers daily and need to translate infrastructure into clarity, not complexity.
* A proactive, solution-oriented mindset: you anticipate friction before others feel it.



  





**What we offer in return:** 




  




* For you to shape the foundation of a platform that powers one of the most exciting frontiers in generative AI.
* The opportunity to work directly with world-class AI researchers and engineers solving cutting-edge problems in gaming and animation.
* Stock Options program
* Retirement Plan
* Health Benefits (5000 SEK/year)
* Life Insurance / Health Insurance / Injury Insurance
* Competitive compensation

title: Test Lead
description:
A Test Manager is a quality assurance professional responsible for overseeing the planning, coordination, and execution of all testing activities within a project or organization. In Agile environments, test managers must balance leadership with adaptability to support dynamic teams and evolving project needs.
 


* **Strategic Planning** 
 : Define QA goals, KPIs, and test strategies aligned with Agile sprints and release cycles
* **Team Enablement** 
 : Mentor testers, foster collaboration, and ensure skill development
* **Test Process Oversight** 
 : Implement and improve Agile-friendly test processes like continuous testing and shift-left practices
* **Stakeholder Communication** 
 : Act as a bridge between QA, developers, product owners, and business stakeholders
* **Metrics and Reporting** 
 : Track test coverage, defect trends, and release readiness with actionable insights
* **Handling multiple tracks** 
 : Need to supervise the testing process to ensure everything goes off without a hitch. The professional should be an expert in adjusting to shifting priorities & deadlines. The ability to adapt testing tactics & plans to new situations and perform efficiently in a fast-paced setting is essential.



**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Define the overall test strategy and approach for data platform components, including data ingestion, processing, storage, and analytics.
* Lead and manage the testing lifecycle across multiple data projects and teams.
* Coordinate test planning, execution, and reporting for data pipelines, ETL/ELT processes, and data services.
* Ensure data quality, integrity, and consistency through rigorous validation and verification processes.
* Collaborate with data engineers, architects, analysts, and business stakeholders to understand requirements and ensure test coverage.
* Oversee the development and maintenance of automated test suites for data validation and regression testing.
* Manage test environments and test data to support various stages of development and deployment.
* Track and report on test metrics, defects, and risks to project stakeholders and leadership.
* Ensure compliance with data governance, privacy, and security standards during testing activities.
* Mentor and guide QA/test engineers in best practices for data testing and automation.
* Continuously improve testing processes, tools, and frameworks to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.
* Support release management and deployment readiness by validating data platform components in staging and production environments.



**Required & nice to have** 




**Must Haves:** 




 12+ years of experience in software testing, with at least 5 years in a manager role.
 



 Strong understanding of testing frameworks, methodologies, and tools (e.g., Selenium, JMeter, Postman, TestNG).
 



 Strong SQL skills – for validating data transformations, integrity, and consistency across systems.
 



 Understanding of data platforms and architectures – including data lakes, data warehouses, and lakehouses.
 



 Experience with ETL/ELT tools
 



 Familiarity with Azure cloud platforms
 



 Knowledge of data quality frameworks and tools
 



 Test automation skills – using tools like PyTest, Selenium (for UI), or custom frameworks for data validation.
 



 Experience with CI/CD pipelines – integrating automated tests into tools like Jenkins, GitLab CI, or Azure DevOps.
 



 Proficiency in scripting languages – such as Python or Shell for automating test cases and data checks.
 



 Understanding of data governance and compliance – including GDPR, HIPAA, and data lineage tracking.
 







**Nice to Have/ Your chance to grow** 




 1. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, including the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams.
 



 2. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, including the ability to identify and resolve issues related to testing.
 



 3. Understanding of project management principles and practices, including planning, scheduling, and resource allocation.
 



 4. Ability to understand and analyze requirements, ensuring that testing activities are aligned with project goals.

title: Infrastructure Engineer
description:
**About the Company** 




  





 At FDJ UNITED, we don't just follow the game, we reinvent it. FDJ UNITED is one of Europe’s leading betting and gaming operators, with a vast portfolio of iconic brands and a reputation for technological excellence. With more than 5,000 employees and a presence in around fifteen regulated markets, the Group offers a diversified, responsible range of games, both under exclusive rights and open to competition. We set new standards, proving that entertainment and safety can go hand in hand. Here, you’ll work alongside a team of passionate individuals dedicated to delivering the best and safest entertaining experiences for our customers every day. We’re looking for bold people who are eager to succeed and ready to level-up the game. If you thrive on innovation, embrace challenges, and want to make a real impact at all levels, FDJ UNITED is your playing field. Join us in shaping the future of gaming. Are you ready to LEVEL-UP THE GAME?
 



  





**About the Role** 




  





 We're looking for an Infrastructure Engineer who thrives on building reliable, scalable, and future-proof systems. In this role, you'll play a key part in maintaining our product portfolio, driving automation, and ensuring our services run smoothly as our organization scales to meet growing demand. This is a great opportunity if you enjoy solving complex problems, writing clean code, and working alongside a team that values collaboration, innovation, and knowledge sharing.
 



  





**Responsibilities** 




  




* Maintain, improve, and optimize our infrastructure and product portfolio.
* Design with change and automation in mind — helping us work smarter, not harder.
* Troubleshoot and support incident handling, while guiding 2nd line teams with prioritization.
* Collaborate across teams to achieve shared goals and deliver reliable services.
* Share your expertise through documentation, mentorship, and continuous knowledge exchange.
* Stay aligned with our values, processes, and compliance standards.



  





**Qualifications** 




  




* Solid understanding of virtualization, automation, and orchestration practices.
* Experience working with large-scale production systems and open-source technologies.
* Proficiency in coding and scripting for automation and infrastructure management.
* Strong communication skills and the ability to build positive working relationships.
* A mindset of curiosity and adaptability, with the drive to improve systems and processes.



  





**Required Skills** 




  




* Solid understanding of virtualization, automation, and orchestration practices.
* Experience working with large-scale production systems and open-source technologies.
* Proficiency in coding and scripting for automation and infrastructure management.
* Strong communication skills and the ability to build positive working relationships.
* A mindset of curiosity and adaptability, with the drive to improve systems and processes.



  





**Preferred Skills** 




  




* Experience with cloud services and infrastructure as code.
* Familiarity with containerization technologies.
* Knowledge of security best practices in infrastructure management.



  





 Be part of a growing company where infrastructure is at the heart of our success. Work in an environment that encourages learning, collaboration, and innovation. Have the freedom to bring new ideas to the table and see them make real impact. Grow your career while helping shape the future of our infrastructure.
 



  





 Ensure that you adhere to the Governance, Risk & Compliance (GRC) obligations for your role. Identify and raise any non-compliance incidents promptly to your line manager. Challenge processes, policies and projects that will negatively impact compliance within the Group. Complete all mandatory compliance training assigned to you. Reach out to the Compliance Teams if unsure of any of your compliance obligations or the requirements are unclear.

title: Security Engineer - Security Operations & Engineering
company_industry: Financial Services, Banking, and Software Development
description:
*Vill du arbeta med teknisk säkerhet i en dynamisk och innovativ miljö? Vi söker nu en kollega som vill vara med och stärka vår organisation genom att hantera och vidareutveckla våra säkerhetslösningar.* 




  





**Om teamet** 




 Security Operations & Engineering består i dag av två Security Engineers och en produktägare. Teamets mission är att proaktivt minimera säkerhetsrisker på ett tekniskt plan. Det gör vi genom att tillhandahålla en operativ säkerhetsfunktion för utvärdering, implementation och konfiguration i nära samarbete med andra team inom Tech på Avanza. Vi har även system- och förvaltningsansvar för flera interna säkerhetsverktyg.
 



  





 Som medlem i teamet kommer du att ha stora möjligheter att påverka teknikval inom säkerhetsområdet och samarbeta dagligen med andra team – i en miljö med högt i tak och korta beslutsvägar.
 



  





**Din profil** 




 Vi söker dig som är en självgående och lösningsorienterad
 **Security Engineer** 
 med passion för teknisk säkerhet. Du trivs i en miljö där du får ta initiativ, och där tekniska diskussioner med kollegor är en naturlig del av vardagen.
 



  





 Du gillar att arbeta operativt, tänka nytt och utmana befintliga lösningar – samtidigt som du brinner för att förbättra och förvalta säkerhetsverktyg. Med din kunskap och ditt engagemang bidrar du till att höja säkerhetsnivån i hela organisationen.
 



 Eftersom teamet har många kontaktytor ser vi att du har god samarbetsförmåga och ett vänligt och hjälpsamt bemötande.
 



  





**Vi Tror Att Du Har** 



* Goda kunskaper inom modernt säkerhetsarbete
* Flerårig erfarenhet av att arbeta med säkerhetsverktyg som SIEM, SOAR, VM, EDR, NDR etc.
* Bred teknisk förståelse för digital infrastruktur (t.ex. nätverk, operativsystem, molnplattformar)
* Praktisk erfarenhet av att hantera säkerhetsincidenter – du har lett eller varit drivande i kritiska situationer
* Relevant utbildning från universitet/högskola eller motsvarande erfarenhet
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift



  





**Det Är Meriterande Om Du Har Erfarenhet Av** 



* Säkerhet i molnplattformar (AWS, Azure, GCP)
* Logganalys, hot- och sårbarhetsanalys, analys av skadlig kod
* Operativt säkerhetsarbete inom SecOps eller SOC
* Att navigera i en reglerad verksamhet med höga krav på dokumentation och efterlevnad
* Säkerhetscertifieringar såsom CISSP, CEH eller OSCP



  





**Ansökan** 




 Urval sker löpande, så skicka gärna din ansökan så snart som möjligt. Vi tar inte emot ansökningar via mejl på grund av GDPR.
 



  





 Erbjudanden från rekryteringsföretag/annonssäljare undanbedes.

title: Senior Test Engineer Cloud (all genders)
description:
We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Senior Tester (all genders) to join our growing Cloud Engineering team. In this role, you will be responsible for ensuring the quality of our cloud-based applications and infrastructure, with a key emphasis on test planning, execution, and automation. You will work closely with developers, cloud engineers, designers, Product Owners and Product Managers to define testing strategies, create comprehensive test plans, and build robust automated test suites.
   

  

 Since our cloud area is still in an early phase of test automation, this role offers a unique opportunity to lead the selection and establishment of test frameworks from the ground up. You will have the freedom to shape our testing approach and set best practices, becoming a key driver in building a solid foundation for quality assurance in our cloud solutions.
   

  

 You will be an advocate for quality, diligently identifying and mitigating risks throughout the development lifecycle.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Define and implement testing strategies for various testing types (e.g., functional, integration, performance, security, regression)
* Design, develop, implement and maintain automated test scripts using industry-standard tools and frameworks.
* Develop and execute comprehensive test plans and test cases based on requirements and design specifications.
* Execute test cases and document results accurately.
* Build and expand our automated test suite to cover critical functionality.
* Work closely with developers and cloud engineers to ensure quality throughout the development lifecycle.
* Analyze test results and provide clear and concise reports to stakeholders.
* Integrate automated tests into our CI/CD pipeline.


**Requirements**
* 7+ years of experience in software testing
* Proficient understanding of software testing methodologies and best practices.
* Experience with test planning, test case design, and test execution.
* Proficiency in at least one test automation framework (e.g., Selenium, Cypress, Playwright).
* Experience with CI/CD pipelines and automated testing integration.
* Familiarity with cloud technologies and concepts (e.g., Azure, AWS, GCP). Practical experience working in Linux environments.
* Knowledge of cloud-related technologies such as gateways, MQTT, and Protobuf.
* Proficient communication, collaboration, and problem-solving skills.
* Proficient written and verbal communication skills in English.


**Soft Skills**
* Proficient collaboration skills, working with developers, engineers, and product roles in agile teams.
* Handle a constantly changing setting with evolving challenges and new developments.
* Capable of functioning effectively in an evolving environment where automated testing structures and procedures are in the process of development.
* Experienced in taking initiative and contributing to the establishment and improvement of test automation frameworks from the ground up.
* Flexible and solution-oriented, with a keen commitment to contribute to the improvement and streamlining of testing processes within a growing organization.
* Thrive in sharing knowledge and learning with other team members, and to take on mentoring role to support junior testers.
* An engaged mindset with a commitment to enhancing quality across the entire development lifecycle.
